base_note.note_text:
TRANSBRONCHIAL CRYOBIOPSY NOTE
Date: 2025-04-13
Patient: Nancy Taylor | MRN: 4019379 | Age: 62F
Attending: Dr. Michael Roberts, MD
Location: University of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, PA

INDICATION: Progressive ILD with UIP pattern on HRCT. Multidisciplinary discussion recommends tissue diagnosis to guide therapy. TBLC (transbronchial lung cryobiopsy) preferred over surgical lung biopsy given comorbidities.

PROCEDURE:
1. Flexible bronchoscopy
2. Transbronchial cryobiopsy (RLL, 2 sites)
3. BAL (RML)

ANESTHESIA: General anesthesia with ETT, blocker on standby

PROCEDURE DETAILS:
Under GA, bronchoscope advanced. Airways inspected - no endobronchial lesions.

BAL performed in RML (120mL instilled, 65mL return).

TBLC performed in RLL using 1.9mm cryoprobe (Erbe):

Site 1 - RB9:
- Fluoroscopy confirmed position 2cm from pleural surface
- Freeze time: 5 seconds x 3 biopsies
- Specimens 4-5mm, excellent quality
- Mild bleeding, controlled with Fogarty balloon

Site 2 - RB10:
- Freeze time: 5 seconds x 2 biopsies
- Specimens 3-4mm, good quality
- Minimal bleeding

Total: 5 cryobiopsies from 2 sites

No pneumothorax on completion fluoroscopy.

SPECIMENS: Cryobiopsy RLL x 5 (surgical pathology for ILD workup)
COMPLICATIONS: Mild bleeding - controlled with blocker
DISPOSITION: 4-hour observation, CXR, discharge if stable

Dr. Michael Roberts, MD

code_rationales.31628: Transbronchial lung biopsy - cryobiopsy is coded as TBLB (31628). No separate cryobiopsy code exists.

coding_review.overall_assessment: TBLC for ILD workup. Cryobiopsy coded as standard TBLB (31628). Multiple biopsies from same lobe do not warrant additional code.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
Bronchoscopy; with bronchoalveolar lavage

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 31628, 31624; total_work_rvu=6.18, total_rvu=9.77 (facility).

variations.note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Dennis Sanders
Medical Record Number: 6502731
Date of Birth: N/A
Age at Procedure: N/A years
Procedure Date: 2025-04-18

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with ild - uip pattern, tissue diagnosis. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Transbronchial Cryobiopsy:
Transbronchial lung parenchymal sampling was performed utilizing standard forceps technique with fluoroscopic localization to minimize pneumothorax risk. 
Bal:
Bronchoalveolar lavage was performed in standardized fashion with sequential aliquot instillation and aspiration to optimize cellular yield. 

INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
Detailed airway examination was performed with findings as documented in the procedural narrative.


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 31628, 31624

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

General

variations.note_text:
On 2025-05-02, Scott Phillips, a None-year-old patient (MRN 5481176), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for ILD - UIP pattern, tissue diagnosis. The patient received General and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included transbronchial biopsy for tissue sampling, and bronchoalveolar lavage for microbiological and cytological analysis. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. Abnormal findings were noted as described in detail above. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is ild - pending. 

Procedural coding: 31628, 31624.
